dialogues.text: (in Persian) Corn, hot corn! Lea mimics the sounds of his words. They laugh. Ahmad han corncob.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Here, take this for him. Lea takes the corncob into the kitchen. In the kitchen, F sitting at the table, cutting the corn stalk with a knife the grilled corn out to him. He ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I don’t want it. Lea notices Fouad’s finger is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: You cut your hand.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: No I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: Yes, you did. You're bleeding! Lea walks towards the door to the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: Ahmad! He cut his finger! 24. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - BATHROOM AND HALLWAY - NIGHT In the bathroom, Ahmad picks Fouad up, holds his finger u and washes it. Lea now comes into the bathroom with the f Lea opens the kit. Ahmad pours some disinfectant over Fou Fouad, who is clearly in pain, tries to be brave. They he door opening. Intrigued, Ahmad leans toward the bathroom who has entered the house. For a brief moment he sees LUC sixteen-year-old daughter, as she quickly climbs the stai bedroom. He is relieved. 25. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - HALLWAY AND THE STAIRS - NIGHT Ahmad goes upstairs. He knocks on the door and hides wait surprise Lucie. He knocks again. Lucie opens the door and Ahmad covers her eyes from behind. Lucie is startled.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Ahmad! Ahmad removes his hands and they hug each other. From dow is standing in front of the bathroom and watching them.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: How did you know it was me?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I knew you were coming today. Ahmad is surprised at Lucie’s response. 26. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Ahmad, Lucie, Lea and Fouad are sitting around the kitche having dinner. A complete Iranian feast, which Ahmad has Fouad has cleaned his plate and turns to Ahmad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have some more? Ahmad takes Fouad’s plate and serves him seconds.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Did you like it?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Very much! Ahmad also serves a second helping for Lea. He wants to r plate but she doesn’t let him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: No, it’s enough.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Come one, have some. You won’t get real Ghormesabzi again soon. Unless you two marry two nice Iranian guys... and you, Fouad, an Iranian girl! Lea laughs. So does Fouad.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: How long will you stay?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It depends on how long our talk will last after dinner.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: (abruptly) What are Iranian girls like?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Iranian girls.. They look like me.. but they're girls! (jokingly) How does that sound?... Like this... Ahmad jokingly takes on the mannerisms of a woman. Fouad

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: What are we to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Have your dinner and I’ll tell you.  27. EXT. MARIE’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT Lucie is seated on the steps of the house leading down to Ahmad pours some water on the ashes of the barbecue and p corner. He picks up the cornhusks strewn on the ground an away. While doing all this, he is speaking to Lucie.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You always come home so late?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Just to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I have nowhere else to spend the night.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Why don’t you want to sleep here?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Same as you. You’d rather go to your friend’s tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: This isn’t my home.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: But your friend’s place is? Ahmad approaches Lucie and sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I’m not comfortable here.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Neither am I.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It’s not the same. For me, it’s hard to face the guy who’s about to marry my ex.. it’s only normal.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Now, she’sjust your ex?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Well, yes.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You lived here with her for years and now she’s just your ex?!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Everything’s changed since then. We got separated... You’re old enough to understand that. Lucie gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I’m old enough not to be preached at.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I’m not here to preach. Your mom asked me to talk to you and see what’s got into you. I don’t know why she thinks you'd tell me more than you tell her.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: She knows perfectly what’s got into me. I don’t want to see that jerk whenever I come home. A long silence between them ensues. Lucie goes into the k

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Lucie, wait! 28. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Lucie wants to leave the kitchen. Ahmad comes into the ki backdoor. He wants her to stay.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Come and sit here. Lucie sits unwillingly.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Isn’t he a good guy?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know him.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Why do you call him a jerk, then? What has he done?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: He hasn’t done anything. He has nothing to do here.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Anyway, you have to accept the fact that it’s your mom’s right to live with whoever she wants.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Whoever she wants? Even a guy with a kid and a wife in a coma?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (curious) Fouad’s mom? Lucie nods. A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: And if she married someone else, would you mind?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: It’d be the same.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: So your problem isn’t him.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Then, what is it? Lucie falls silent for a moment. Fighting back tears, she Ahmad.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I’m sixteen years old and since I was born, my mom’s changed guys three times. And it’s always the same story. They come, stay for a few years, and then they leave. Ahmad understands what Lucie means and has nothing to say He too is upset. He gets up with the excuse of clearing t has his back to Lucie. Perhaps to stop Lucie from seeing And again there is silence.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Would you talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Talk her out of this marriage. Ahmad laughs at what Lucie has said; a bitter laugh. The front door opening is heard. 29. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - NIGHT Marie enters the house. From between the door to the chil she sees Fouad and Lea who are not yet sleeping and talki other. She is pressed to know if Lucie has come home. She purse and coat on her bed and enters the kitchen.  30. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Marie is elated to see Lucie. Lucie immediately gets up t kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Good evening. Lucie mumbles to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: (imitating Ahmad and in Persian) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Lucie, can you sleep downstairs tonight? Fouad will go up with Ahmad.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I kept you some food. Haven’t you had dinner?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No. Lucie leaves. Marie sees the food that Ahmad has kept for wasn’t expecting Persian food.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Oh la la ! Thank you.. Where did you get the herbs?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: We went shopping with the kids. Marie sits at the table and starts to eat. Ahmad gets bus dishes in the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Do you want me to heat it up if it’s cold?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No.. You're still a great cook!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: The one thing I’m stil great at. What time must we be there tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (Giving her a spoon) You don’t eat Ghormesabzi with a fork.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Did you talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You can guess. She doesn’t like you remarrying.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She’s worried that you’1l live with him for a while and that he’1l take off.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Tell her to be sure that this one won't leave.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I don’t think I’m the right person to convince her to be happy you’re getting married.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (a bit angry) I ‘m not asking her to be happy. I just want to know what she’s after.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Stopping this marriage. Marie laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It made me laugh too. Marie now stops laughing while chewing the food she has i Ahmad wants to leave.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Try to convinve her before you make your decision.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: My decision’s made. Ahmad leaves the kitchen. While eating her food, Marie is thought.  31. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - UPSTAIRS BEDROOM - NIGHT The lights are out. Street light shines in through the wi lying down on the lower bunk and Fouad is on the top. Bot trouble falling asleep. Fouad is looking at Ahmad from in spaces in the slats of his bed; Ahmad’s hand, Ahmad’s mou trying to find out if Ahmad is asleep, but he can’t see h shifts restlessly. The bed squeaks. Ahmad hears him movin

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Fouad?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: If you're not comfy, we can switch beds.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I'm ok.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Then, why aren’t you asleep? Fouad does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Close your eyes and go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Go, then. Go... Fouad doesn’t move, Ahmad realizes that he is afraid of g himself. He gets up to accompany him. 32. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - NIGHT Ahmad and Fouad walk downstairs towards the restroom. Ahm the light. Fouad goes inside and closes the door. Ahmad w dark hallway for him to come out. Marie’s bedroom is next restroom. Ahmad notices the light pouring out from under bedroom door. He hears a noise from inside the room. He s the muffled sounds of a conversation between two people. ease. He doesn’t want to stay there. He walks back upstai 33. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - UPSTAIRS ROOM - NIGHT Ahmad is distraught and cannot sleep. He is concerned tha not returned. 34. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Samir is lying on the bed. Marie cradeling his head and p drops into his eyes. As she is doing this, they are quiet each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Did you talk to her doctor too?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: No, just the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: The scratches on her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: They happened after my last two visits.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Maybe it has nothing to do with your visits. Maybe it was involuntary.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You’d like it to be involuntary? Marie is shocked by what Samir has said. She closes the e and sits on the edge of the bed. Samir closes his eyes to sting. From Marie’s silence, he realizes that he has upse

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Do you hear yourself? You can’t say whatever you want and then just apologize. Marie wants to continue the discussion but is interrupted of someone knocking on the door. Marie gets up and opens Fouad is behind the door. It is clear that he is scared o

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: It’s dark. I can’t go up.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Why do you want to go up?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I asked him to go upstairs with Ahmad. The girls are together.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Maybe he is not comfortable sleeping with a stranger. Samir gets up from the bed and comes towards Fouad.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Get your things. We’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I’m spleepy. I want to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You asked me to come get you!

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I want to stay.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You can sleep in my bed. Fouad lies down on Marie’s bed. Marie tucks him in. 35. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN AND HALLWAY - MORNING The next morning, Lucie, Lea and Fouad are sitting around table finishing off their breakfast. The sink is full of clearly clogged. Ahmad is sitting on the floor and is bus drainpipe under the sink. Marie who has taken a shower, e kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Ahmad leave it.. we’re running late.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: The sink is clogged.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It can wait. We have to be there by 9. Hurry up, kids. Marie leaves the kitchen. Ahmad opens the drainpipe. All the sink pours into the bucket which Ahmad has placed und sink. Ahmad clears the clogged pipe and dirties his hands process. Samir, who has just woken up, enters the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Hi. Lea and Fouad answer him. Lucie ignores his presence.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (to Ahmad) ‘Morning... Samir. Ahmad whose hands are dirty, gets up to greet him respect not offer his hand to shake.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: My hands are dirty, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s blocked again?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It’s unblocked. I’1l just screw it back on. Samir joins the children seated at the kitchen table. As sits, Lucie grabs her last bite and without saying anythi kitchen and walks in the hallway. She comes face-to-face is getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Get ready, Lucie, we'll drop you off.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: No need, I'll go by myself. Lucie goes to her room. Marie comes to the kitchen. Ahmad reattaching the drainpipe. Samir is eating his breakfast. sitting down at the table, Marie grabs a bite to eat.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Ahmad, we're late.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It’s finished. Ahmad turns on the water to verify the pipe he has reatta leak. Marie notices Samir who is pretending to be busy wi breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (to the kids) Get moving, kids. Lea and Fouad finish their breakfasts and leave the kitch for school.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It’s leaking.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: There’s always been a leak.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I told you the joint has to be changed. I’1l take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (to Ahmad) Did you eat anything?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (thinks Marie is talking to him) Not yet. Ahmad turns off the tap. He takes the bucket from under leaves the kitchen. Marie and Samir are sitting at the ta kitchen concentrating on their breakfasts. They are both 36. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - TOILET AND BATHROOM - MORNING Ahmad is ironing his shirt when Lucie gently opens the do in to wash her hands.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Can I see you after?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Don’t you have class?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I can skip. Marie cracks the bathroom door open.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Ahmad!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Coming... (to Lucie) What time do you get out of school?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: One. 37. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - THE ROOM FACING THE YARD - EXT.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Samir is wearing some work clothes and is standing on a s painting a wall. As he paints, he looks out the window an give the car keys to Ahmad. Samir has a strange feeling, them together bothers him. Lucie comes into the room to g She has her backpack on her shoulder and is ready to go t wasn’t expecting to see Samir. Samir climbs down the ladd and pulls the plastic cover away from her things. Without attention to him, Lucie searches the computer desk for so does not find it. This is a good excuse for Samir to star conversation with her.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Looking for something?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: No. Lucie goes out. Samir is left alone. 38. INT. SAMIR’S CAR - EXT. STREET OUTSIDE LEA’S SCHOOL - Lea and Fouad are seated next to each other on the backse behind the wheel and Marie is sitting in the passenger's

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Go right.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Isn’t that the school Lucie went to?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Yes. The car turns then stops in front of a school’s main entr out and Fouad follows her.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: (while getting out) Bye, Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Bye, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: (mimicking Lea) Bye, Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Bye! Wait, let me see.. Marie cleans the corner of Fouad’s eye with her finger. L go towards the school. The car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Where did you two meet?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: At the pharmacy, he’d come in for his wife’s medication.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What was wrong with his wife?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She was depressed. Ahmad smirks. Marie notices his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (mimics Ahmad’s smirk) What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: We call it a smile.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: We call it mocking. What's funny about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss our fights, darling?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Is her depression funny to you? Ahmad puts on the turning indicator and slowly pulls over

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (jokingly) Look, if you start bugging me, I’11 get out right now and go back to Tehran. I won’t come to court and I won't divorce you and then let’s see what you do.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It’s just your hair that’s gone grey. Nothing else has changed.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What should I do? Should I get out?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Stop joking, we’re late. Ahmad laughs and starts driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie and Ahmad are sitting on a bench in a courthouse in of Paris..

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Seriously, what did you think of him?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: First tell me how serious all this is, then I’11 tell you what I think.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Serious enough for me to be pregnant. Ahmad, who is clearly shocked at hearing this news, tries sadness and they both fall silent. The lawyer comes out o calls Marie, who gets up.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Is that a joke?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No. Marie enters the office accompanied by the lawyer. Ahmad Marie, he is deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie and Ahmad are sitting in front of the judge’s desk lawyer is seated between them. The judge reads their divo and asks for their consent, with that the administrative divorce is completed. During this procedure, Marie’s phon quietly speaks a few sentences without being heard. The j Marie with an expression that means she cannot speak on t no other choice, Marie hangs up the phone. 41. EXT. MARIE’S HOUSE - YARD - DAY Samir, who is still in his work clothes, is in the yard a on the phone. His hands are covered in paint.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hello, Marie.. He hangs up, redials, then leaves a message. The airline representative, who has delivered Ahmad’s suitcase, is ho documents and waiting at the door. Ahmad’s damaged suitca ground, its locks have been broken.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Marie... they’ve brought the suitcase. It’s broken. I don’t know if something’s missing, if I should accept it or not... Call me back. Samir hangs up and goes towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What if something’s missing?

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: Doesn’t he have insurance?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: What do we do, then? Will you take it or should I bring it back to the airport and he can come and follow up on it? Samir goes towards the suitcase to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: Can you sign here? The airline representative notices Samir’s eyes, which ar Samir signs.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (surprised) Why?

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: Your eyes...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Oh! I’m allergic to the paint.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: (while leaving) Change jobs! The airline representative goes towards his car to get in have put Samir deep in thought. 42. EXT. STREET OUTSIDE LUCIE’S SCHOOL - DAY Ahmad is standing on the sidewalk among the students fili school, waiting for Lucie to come out. Lucie exits the th too is looking for Ahmad. Ahmad walks towards her. 43. INT. SHAHRYAR’S RESTAURANT - DAY A typical neighborhood restaurant with an open kitchen lo back where the chefs are busy cooking. The ambience of th is Italian. SHAHRYAR, the middle-aged and friendly owner, customer’s order. The restaurant is bustling, most of the full of diners. Ahmad and Lucie enter the restaurant. The Shahryar who has not yet noticed them.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Excuse me, where’s the bus stop to Tajrish? Shahryar looks up. He is shocked to see Ahmad.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) What the hell are you doing here?! Shahryar gets up from behind the till and comes towards A both hug each other warmly and start joking and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian and pointing to Lucie) Do you recognize her?

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) She’s grown up. (to Lucie) Do you remember when you were little, he’d put you on his bike and bring you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Persian) That was Lea.. this is Lucie! You’ve always mixed them.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) How tall she’s become. (to Lucie) How are you?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) You haven't had lunch?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Why else would we bother to come here?!

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Sit, I'll be right with you. Ahmad and Lucie move towards a table to sit down, Shahrya towards the kitchen. Valeria, Shahryar’s Italian wife, is kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Italian) Valeria, your friend’s here. Valeria sees Ahmad. Ahmad walks towards her. She is happy

dialogues.speaker: VALERIA
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Ahmad... Hello. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Hello, dear Valeria.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: You remember Lucie?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIA
dialogues.text: Hello.. what a beautiful lady you've become!... Valeria warmly embraces Lucie.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You two are still together?

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) There is this tiny thing in common between us to keep us from separating.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) The colors of our flags.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (to Valeria) What is he saying?

dialogues.speaker: VALERIA
dialogues.text: He talks too much.. let him. How’s your mom?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: She’s good. Valeria goes to the kitchen. Ahmad and Lucie sit at the t picks up the menu to look it over.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Did you go to court?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: SO, it’s over now?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It was already over. You still like ravioli? Ahmad sets the menu down. He notices Lucie’s sad eyes, st the distance.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What is it? Lucie does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You know, this guy... I don’t think he’s that bad... Lucie again does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: He must be going through a difficult time. Put yourself in his shoes.  Between his wife and his concern for his son...

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: How does she want to marry a married man?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: But you said his wife’s in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: But she’s not dead; she might not die...

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: That’s his problem. That’s no one else’s business...

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Do you know why his wife’s in a coma?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: No, how would I know?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: My mom didn’t tell you?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: She committed suicide. Ahmad is shocked by what Lucie is telling him. He remains saddened by what he has learned.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Because of her depression? Lucie, who has until now fought back her tears, suddenly and start to cry. She tries to prevent the other diners f her but many of them turn to see why she is crying. Ahmad her to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (quietly) Lucie. look at me... Worried, Shahryar comes to their table.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Lucie.. get up, we’ll get some fresh air. Ahmad takes Lucie’s hand and gets her up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: Take her to the back. Ahmad leads Lucie to the small back room of the restauran can compose herself. Concerned by Lucie’s outburst, Valer questioningly at Shahryar. Shahryar shrugs. 44, INT. SHAHRYAR’S RESTAURANT - BACK ROOM - DAY A small room with a bed and Shahryar’s personal things. I boxes of soft drink, mineral water and food supplies. Ahm down on the bed and unties her scarf and puts it aside.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Do you know why she doesn’t tell anyone that this guy’s wife has committed suicide?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Calm down.. calm down for now, we’1l talk later.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Because she doesn’t want anyone to find out.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: That it’s because of their affair that she tried to kill herself. Although he’s shocked, but Ahmad pretends to not take Luc

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t speak of these things with such certainty.. especially at your age.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Then, don’t say I’ve grown up if you don't think so. Lucie gets up to leave. Ahmad holds her and stops her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Sorry. Lucie sits down. More silence.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I don’t want them to be together.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You think it’s up to you and me? I’m nobody in this story.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: If they get married then 1/11 never.. I'll never set foot in that house again.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Your mother is pregnant. Lucie looks at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You're lying. Lucie, emotionally drained, stands up and leaves the room follows her. 45. EXT. STREET OUTSIDE SHAHRYAR’S RESTAURANT - DAY - CON Lucie exits the restaurant and starts walking down the si walks next to her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You know why she went with that asshole?... Cause he looks like you! He reminds her of you! Ahmad has no answer to give Lucie. Lucie leaves. Ahmad st a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old shop in Paris. A large number of old and new chand other lamps are hanging from the ceiling of the shop. All store are table lamps in various sizes and shapes. Samir looking at the chandeliers hanging from the ceiling to pi out. 47. INT. SAMIR’S CAR - EXT. STREET - DAY Several chandeliers and lamps are placed on the backseat. sitting behind the wheel and Marie in the front seat. The through the busy streets of Paris. Samir is deep in thoug senses it and quietly waits for him to speak. Without loo Marie gently reaches over to hold his hand and closes her moment later, Samir has to remove his hand in order to sh Marie opens her eyes. They drive on in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmad comes up the stairs in a metro station. It is raini the gift he has bought out of its plastic bag and pulls t his head to prevent his head from getting wet. He crosses street, reaches the sidewalk and hugs the wall as he walk dry as possible.  49, INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - HALLWAY - NIGHT Marie walks towards the front door. She opens the door. A soaked from the rain, comes inside.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You're soaked!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It started pouring...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Want a coffee?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: No, I’ve just come to get my suitcase. I can’t miss the last train.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It’s right here. At least, wait till the rain stops.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It’s not stopping soon. Ahmad’s words have worried Marie even more.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Is Lucie back?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No. Worried, Ahmad leans against the hallway wall.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Watch the paint. Ahmad looks at his coat which is not stained with paint. suitcase in the hallway. He walks towards it and sees the broken.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It was broken when they delivered it.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Did you call her friends?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I’ve called them so often looking for her that I’m embarrassed to do it again. Ahmad finds his towel among the things in his suitcase an face. He tries to close the suitcase but it will not clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you talk to her today?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Yes. Can I have a piece of string or something?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You have a couple of suitcases left in the shed. You can take one of them.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Are the kids sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Marie goes inside. 50. INT. MARIE’S YARD - SHED - NIGHT Ahmad is in the shed looking for his suitcases, which he from a few years ago. From among the clutter piled up in pulls out two dusty suitcases. He unzips the larger suitc clothing, a few black and white pictures of Ahmad from wh Paris and other personal items are in the suitcase. Seein belongings changes his mood. 51. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Marie is standing by the window facing the backyard. The the rain can be seen. Samir is standing on the kitchen ta installing a chandelier. Ahmad comes in the back kitchen empty suitcase and heads towards the hallway. Marie and S look at the suitcase he’s holding. Ahmad leaves the kitch dominating silence.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Turn it on, please. Marie walks towards the switch and turns on the light. Th is lit up. Samir comes down from the table. He notices ho Marie is. Ahmad enters the kitchen with the plastic bag h gifts he has brought from Tehran and the gift he has boug He places the gifts on the kitchen table and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Will you tell the kids to come here before they go to sleep, so that I can give them their gifts? Marie is about to leave the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Should Fouad come too?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, he wasn’t supposed to get one.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I got him something today.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Can I ask you not give it to him?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (bewildered) Why? Marie is also astonished and is looking at Samir.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: He’s done something wrong. He needs to be punished...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: They should both be punished, then.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I can only speak for my son. Samir’s words have upset Marie.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What’ve they done?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: They took the gift out of your suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (laughing) But the gift was still in there.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I put it back. But we can’t let them off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: The suitcase was open, they got tempted...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (impatiently wanting to leave) I'll ask them to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: This way they’1l learn that there will always be a way to get away with any situation by apologizing.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: But I’ve already told them I’ve brought gifts.. I can’t pretend now I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (to Samir, frustrated) Can you please let go? I’ve already scolded them enough.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (a bit upset) I was just asking if it was possible. Ahmad is in a dilemma. He doesn’t know how to respond, bu to get the kids. Ahmad and Samir are standing opposite ea the kitchen. There is silence and the tension between the They avoid making eye contact with one another. Samir can situation any longer and gets up from the table with the closing the window that Marie had left open when she was cigarette. He sees the light in the shed, which Ahmad has passes through the backyard in the rain and turns off the shed and comes back to the kitchen. Marie enters the kitc and Fouad.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (friendly) Good evening, kids. Ahmad takes the plastic bag to take out the gifts.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No, first you both have to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: I apologize. Everyone is waiting for Fouad to apologize but he is quie

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I didn’t take it from the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: But you were with her when she did it.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: But I didn’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter who took it. You were together, you could’ve stopped her. Fouad is silent and does not respond. Angry, Samir stands towards him and stares into his eyes. Ahmad is uncomforta

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: “I apologize”.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) I apologize.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (commandingly) “I apologize”!

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: (with no other choice) I apologize. Samir goes back to his seat and sits down. Ahmad gives Le the two boxes. For Lea a remote controlled helicopter and giftwrapped box. The children thank him but they are not with the scolding they have received. 52. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - CHILDREN’S ROOM - NIGHT Lea and Fouad are in their beds.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: You pretended like it was me.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I just said I didn’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: That means it was me!

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: It was you.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: But you told me his suitcase was open. Otherwise, I wouldn’t have gone.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to listen. You didn’t have to go.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: I know why you're mad. You didn’t get a helicopter. You got colored pencils.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: You’re insane.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Shut up! Lea is upset at him. She gets up, takes her blanket and l to sleep in another room. 53. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Marie holds the dress which Ahmad brought for her up to h shows it to Ahmad and Samir. Both men are looking at Mari

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I got the size you used to wear.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It still wear the same size.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I have a gift for Lucie too. I’ll give it to her later.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She’s never been so late. Samir gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I'll go look for her.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I don’t know.. nearby... in the streets, at the station.. where are the keys?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You had them.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Can I come with you, if you don’t mind?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (with no other choice) Sure. If you want.  Samir leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She might not want to come back with him.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Why did she cry at the restaurant today?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Who told you?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I called Shahryar and he said she suddenly burst ito tears. She’s never been this late. What have you told her that has made her stay out until now?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (calmly) You hadn't told her you were pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (worried) You did?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I thought she’d let it go if she knew

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: That’s why she’s not back. You weren’t supposed to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I didn’t know. What kind of secret is that, anyway? She’d have found out someday!

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Not when she’s so upset.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Her problem is not your being pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What is her problem? Ahmad seems reluctant to answer. Marie stands in front of for a reply.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (a bit upset) What’s her problem?... huh?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (with no other choice) She seems to know everything.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Everything about what? Samir comes to the kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I can’t find the keys.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (angry) Well, look for them! Samir is surprised to see Marie so up. Ahmad is visibly u

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: We’1l talk later.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean by “knowing everything”? I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She says that his wife committed suicide because of your affair. Marie gets even angrier upon hearing this. Ahmad, who fee said what he needed to say, tries again to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She committed suicide because...

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I’11 call you tomorrow and we can speak then. Samir enters the kitchen to take his coat.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (angrier) The keys are not here.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I got them.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: So why you are here?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Does somebody mind my being here?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No, but...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Forget it. Samir leaves the house and Ahmad tries to go outside wit

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (to Samir) Wait, I’m coming.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Ahmad.. his wife had been depressed for some time.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Every time I’d take my clothes there, I’d see her.. You could tell that she was unwell.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Why was she unwell?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean why?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Nothing, forget it.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Look, either don’t say something or if you do, say it clearly.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You said every time you saw her, she felt unwell...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t say she felt unwell, I said she was unwell!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Forget it. This is just getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (quietly) You'd really like to hear that it was my fault if that woman committed suicide?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (quietly) I don’t want to hear anything. You asked me to go and talk to your daughter. I’m just telling what she thinks. That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She’s wrong. She must come and have a conversation with me and I'll tell her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Do you want to tell her what you told me? Do you think she’s going to buy that?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Does that matter? She’s the one who...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What’s so unbelievable about it?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I also find it hard to believe that the mother of a five-year-old would commit suicide because of depression.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Look who’s talking! Have you forgotten the state you were in? This woman committed suicide another time when her baby was nine-month-old! Was it also my fault? I was with you, back then! Ahmad falls silent upon hearing this.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Her depression started right after the birth. Do you want to know what meds Samir would come and get for her? 54. INT. AND EXT. SAMIR’S CAR - NIGHT Ahmad and Samir are in the car, driving up and down the s their neighborhood searching for Lucie.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: How long are you staying in town?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I haven't booked my return yet.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Couldn’t you have sent a lawyer to take care of the divorce instead of coming all this way?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Sure, but I wanted to come. I wanted to see the kids, and Marie-Anne too... to end on good terms.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: But it doesn’t seem to be the end. There’s still something going on.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: No.. What makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When two people meet four years later and start fighting again, it means things are still unresolved.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: We were arguing about Lucie. They are both quiet now, searching the streets in silence

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Lucie’s problem is me.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: No.. it’s a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: About what? Ahmad does not wish to answer.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Anything personal that I shouldn’t know?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I that case, I want you to tell me... You may know Marie is carrying my child. It’s not good for her to be stressed out all the time, smoking so many cigarettes...

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I’m worried about her too. She didn’t use to smoke.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I won't let this girl destroy her mother. If she has a problem, sh

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She has no problem. I told you, it’s a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What is this fucking misunderstanding that has been screwing our lives for months?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Marie-Anne can tell you.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Leave her out of this.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She is making assumptions about your wife.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: She thinks she committed suicide because of our relationship?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: So you know...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I overheard your conversation.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: She did that because of a stupid story with a customer.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I heard she was depressed.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Otherwise, she wouldn’t have tried to kill herself for nothing. What can I do if Lucie doesn’t believe me? I can send her my employee. She saw the whole thing. 55. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - NIGHT Samir and Ahmad enter the house through the front door. M door open. Curious and restless, she comes out of the bed Samir and Ahmad’s expression, she realizes that their sea fruitless. Samir places the umbrella in a corner and walk

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: We should call the police. They may find her. Concerned, Ahmad stands in the doorway. Marie approaches

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Has she already stayed out all night?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No, it’s the first time.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Maybe she went to her father’s.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: To Brussels?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: He’s not in Paris anymore?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No, he’s back in Brussels.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You think she can be there?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (doubtful) She’s on bad terms with him too.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Do you want me to call?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (to Ahamd) It’s better if you do it. Samir brushes past Marie and goes to the bedroom. Ahmad i uncomfortable with the request Marie has made.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I doubt she’d have gone to Brussels. Marie notices that Ahmad would perfer not to call Lucie’s

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (upset) Fine, Ill do it.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Ok, give me his number. Marie goes to get the number.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Shahryar called twice. He wants you to call him back.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Where’s the phone?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: In the kitchen. Ahmad goes to the kitchen. 56. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Lea is lying down under the blanket on her mother’s bed. feeling down and is seated on the edge of the bed. Marie worried. She is looking for her address book. Everyone is sees that Samir is deep in thought, he running his finger hair.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Where did she get this idea?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Celine’s suicide.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know... Marie finds her address book and starts to leave the bedr exiting, she realizes that her reaction has upset Samir. towards Samir and sits next to him affectionately. Lea, w fallen asleep, turns around and sees their backs facing h takes the eye-drops and drops some medication into his ey 57. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN AND HALLWAY - NIGHT Ahmad is holding the phone and speaking to Shahryar.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Okay, thanks.... Okay, I will... Bye. Marie is standing there holding the phonebook and is wait to get off the phone to give him the number.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Her father’s number. But try not to worry him. He’s fragile...

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She’s at Shahryar’s. Marie is shocked and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She went to the restaurant and he took her in. Marie, who until now had tried to control herself, sudden angry.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: But he called twice! Why didn’t he tell me? He heard how worried I was! Why didn’t he tell me? I’ve been worried sick all night!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I’ll explain.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (shouting) Explain what? What do you want to explain? Samir, curious about the commotion, comes into the kitche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (firmly) I’ve already asked you to go through me!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (even more firmly) And I ask you not to raise your voice in front of me.. okay? Suddenly, everyone is quiet. Samir tries to control himse

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Why didn’t he tell me she was there?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (to Marie) Lucie made him promise.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: He promised to hide a sixteen-year-old girl in his house and not tell anyone?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What do you mean hide?!

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (nervous) Why has he taken her to his house?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: He felt sorry for her.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Didn’t he feel sorry for her mother?! Ahmad holds his tongue not to start a fight. Marie sudden leave the kitchen. She takes a few steps and as if forget something, she comes back.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (to Samir) The keys.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She has to come back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She has to come here, sit her ass down and listen!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Right now!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She thinks we don’t know she’s there.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don’t care! I want her to come and see the mess she’s put me in! I want her to know that I didn’t cause this woman’s suicide! Fouad, standing in the doorway, has heard everything. 58. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Marie rushes to put on her raincoat. Samir is standing ne and Lea is on the bed. Although her eyes are closed, it i she is not sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: If you go to get her now, she won't come home with you.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (angry) Then, I’1l call the police to bring her back. I swear I will.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: The police will bring her back one night. What about tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Either she comes back here or she goes and lives with her father in Brussels. Marie comes towards the door to leave. Samir blocks her p

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: She won’t come back as long as I’m here. They stare at each other in silence. 59. INT. SHAHRYAR’S HOUSE - NIGHT The house is mostly dark, only one light is on in the kit Shahryar’s house is not very large. It has been decorated Iranian home. The television is on and Shahryar is sitti opposite it. He is watching a football game. Two commenta debating a referee call. They each present their own poin The penalty sequence is repeated several times in slow mo graphics. The referee’s call cannot be confirmed. The doo interrupts the sound of the show. Shahryar gets up and wa the door. He opens the door for Ahmad. Ahmad walks in wit suitcase. Both men speak quietly.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Hello.. come in.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Is she up?

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) She has fallen asleep.. come in.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: Hardly here and already in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: When did she come to you?

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: It was late. I thought she had come looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You should have called right then. Her mother was so worried.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: How can I call you? You don’t have a phone! I called the house looking for you but you weren’t there. I was afraid if I told her mother, that she would find out and leave in the middle of the night... What’s wrong with her?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She’s imagining things. 60. INT. SHAHRIAR’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Without making any noise, Ahmad turns on the dim bedside near Lucie’s bed. He wants to gently wake Lucie up. He is but without a choice, puts his hand on her shoulder and g her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Lucie... Lucie opens her eyes and is surprised to see Ahmad next

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Sorry to wake you.. your mom is waiting for you. Lucie who it seems has just realized where she is, is sta without saying anything.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She wanted to come and get you. I asked her to not come, I promised I would take you back. Come on, get up. Lucie sits up.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Where’s your jacket? Lucie has only now realized what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I won’t go. I don’t wanna go back tonight. Lucie’s pleas leave Ahmad less certain. He doesn’t know w

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Then I’1l call her and you can tell her that you’ll go back tomorrow morning, okay? Lucie doesn’t respond. Ahmad leaves the room to get the p sitting on the edge of the bed by herself. Ahmad comes ba phone and dials a number and waits.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Marie-Anne? Hold on, please. He gives the phone to Lucie and signals to her to speak.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes?... I’m staying here tonight. She listens for a long time to the other end. From Lucie’ clear that her mother is speaking relentlessly and perhap her. Lucie still does not speak. Ahmad is worried and is her. Marie has said what she wanted to say and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Why did you hang up?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: She did.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Get out of bed. Let’s go talk. 61. INT. SHAHRYAR’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Ahmad closes the kitchen door behind him. Lucie goes to t washes her face. Ahmad sits at the table and waits for he at the table opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I want you to listen carefully. I don’t know how much you remember of the last few months I was living with your mother. Do you remember anything?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Uhum.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Do you remember the state I was in?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I was always feeling down. I wasn’t working, I stopped going out, I just didn’t want to exist anymore. So, when your mom says that woman committed suicide because she was depressed, I can understand what it means. Even with a young child...

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Did you often think of killing yourself?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Yes, sometimes?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You never thought of drinking detergent in front of Lea and me to die?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (shocked) What? No!

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You think that a woman who goes to her husband’s shop and downs a bottle of detergent in front of her son and collapses only means to die? Ahmad is silent. Lucie is trying not to burst into tears earlier that day before finishing what she had to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn’t she take pills and die in her bed?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Look, we can spend the night imagining things. But it’s all speculation. We'll see Samir’s employee tomorrow. She has things to tell you. Lucie is struggling to maintain her composure. Ahmad is d thought. There’s a brief silence between them. 62. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - MORNING Fouad is dressed, he takes his toothbrush from among the toothbrushes and comes out of the bathroom. 63. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - MORNING Marie and Samir are in each other’s arms, lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Tell her I’ve left and she can come back. It’s better if Fouad and I don’t stay here for a while. Marie pulls herself away from Samir’s embrace. Samir leav kitchen. Marie remains alone in the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir and his son are sitting next to each other towards metro car. The metro approaches a station. Samir takes Fo goes towards the exit door. Fouad is sitting stubbornly i The door opens and Samir gets off assuming that Fouad is Suddenly he realizes that Fouad has not gotten off. Scare returns to the car and runs towards Fouad.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go! Fouad is being stubborn. Samir takes his hand. Fouad resi manages to take him out of the car by force and drags him wall for a serious talk.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What is that about? Why don’t you get off? Look at me!

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I want to go back to Marie’s.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: We have to go home for now.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: You told me our home was there, forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but some things have changed.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: It’s because of the man who came? Samir does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Because I misbehaved yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Why doesn’t Lucie like you?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Because she thinks I want to take her mommy away from her.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: But she doesn’t like her mommy.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Of course she does. All children love their mommies. Just like you miss your mommy.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: But Mommy’s not home anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Would you like to go see her? Do you want to go to see her tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: She scares me.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Your mommy?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: She’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Don’t say such things, Fouad. If she was dead, they wouldn’t have kept her in the hospital, with the machines.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: If they take them away, she’1ll die? Why don’t they take them away?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Because we don’t know if she wants to stay alive like this or if she wants to die.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: She wants to die.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (shocked) Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: She killed herself. It means that she wanted to die. Fouad’s words have upset Samir. He hug Fouad.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Sorry, Daddy. 65. INT. SHAHRIAR’S RESTAURANT - DAY Naima is seated at one of the tables in the restaurant. H reveals her state of anxiety. Ahmad and Lucie are seated and they watch her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Did his wife work there too?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: Yes, for a few days. Samir had brought her to clear her head. Naima takes the garment out from its cover and places it Ahmad and Lucie.

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: And that day, she had a fight with a customer over this stain. The customer said that the dress had been stained at the cleaner’s. Samir’s wife said no, it had it before it was brought in to the cleaner’s.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: That’s all?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: To make things better, I told her to leave the dress and come and get it the next day. The customer said that the next day would be too late, because the dress belonged to a guest of the hotel where she worked and the guest was catching a flight that afternoon. She said we had a couple of  hours to get the stain out.. and I said okay... Suddenly Celine started screaming at me, saying it wasn’t for me to say, that this dress had the stain before we got it and it’s not our problem. The customer started yelling and even cursed. Samir’s wife got upset and threw the dress on the sidewalk. I didn’t know what to do.. They pushed each other around a bit, and the customer decided to call the police.. So I asked her to let me leave so that when the police comes, I wouldn’t be there...

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You work illegally?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: Yes. But Céline said “you have to stay and tell the police that when you got the dress, it was already stained”. So I called Samir without her seeing me to and asked him to come quickly. When he came and heard the story, he got very angry with his wife and said sorry to the customer and said he’d pay for the dress. He asked her to call the police and tell them that the issue was resolved. The customer said she'd do it only if his wife apologized to her. And then Celine started screaming and yelling at me saying I had no right to call Samir behind her back. I didn’t say anything. I just took my purse to leave, but Samir came and took my hand, like this... He said I had to stay. Instead, he asked his wife to leave. In front of the customer, in front of me, he threw her out.. and I stayed. Now all three are quiet. Upset, Ahmad looks at the stain the dress and Lucie stares at Naima who is upset.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: How many days before her suicide was that?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: I think four or five days... Can I go?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Thank you. Naima gets up. She takes the dress, says goodbye and leav up and accompanies her to the door. Lucie is still seated thought. Ahmad returns to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s what depression’s like. Small things can suddelnly set you off.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears) The day before her suicide, I forwarded her all the love letters my mom and Samir had emailed each other. Ahmad is astonished. He is looking in disbelief at Lucie revealed her secret and does not even have the energy to silence between them. 66. EXT. SHAHRYAR’S RESTAURANT - SIDEWALK - DAY Lucie exits the restaurant. They stand on the sidewalk to upset and looking at Ahmad.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What are you going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I'll go to Brussels.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Don’t be silly. You won’t last a minute there. You have to go back to your mom's.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I can’t wake up every morning and face the guy whose wife is dead because of me!I can’t look his son in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Come sit down. Ahmad seats Lucie down on the chair in front of the resta opposite her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Do you want me to help you?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: (worried) You're not going to tell my mom...

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Listen... Lucie gets up.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: (frantic) No, I don’t want her to know.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn’t have told you.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Hold on, listen.. You either keep this to yourself and suffer for the rest of your life, or you talk to your mom.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: What'd that chage?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It might change her decision to marry him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: He decision’s made, she’s pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What if she finds out about this after her child is born? Then, it’d really be too late.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: If I'd felt like telling her, I would’ve done it.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: It’s not about you feeling like it or not. You have to ask yourself if it is important for your mother. She has the right to know. 67. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - HALLWAY - DAY Marie is busy putting away the groceries. From the hallwa quietly stands in the kitchen doorway. Marie doesn’t noti presence. She turns around, sees him standing behind her. startled, screams, then laughs at her own reaction.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You’re here?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I was upstairs with Lucie. Ahmad comes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: How was your meeting?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: What meeting?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: With Samir’s employee.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: between them. Ahmad helps Marie put away the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Had you told Lucie I was coming to Paris?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: How did she know, then?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Did she know?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Yes

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe she reads your emails. (showing a bottle) Where do you keep this? Marie takes the bottle of dishwashing liquid from Ahmad t cupboard. Ahmad’s words have peaked her curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Did something happen?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Shall we go for a walk?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No, I’m tired. What’s the matter, Ahmad? Ahmad goes to the door to close it so that they may speak Ahmad sits down. waiting for him to speak. Marie sits down opposite him. Marie is staring at him, INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - UPSTAIRS ROOM - DAY Lea is sitting next to Lucie on the edge of the bed. A br Lea looks at Lucie’s worried face.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: You want to go live with Dad? Lucie thinks for a moment then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: I£ you go, I’1l come with you.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You have to stay here with Mom.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: I want to be with you.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: It’s not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: Dad’s wife is a bit weird. There is silence between them. Ahmad calls Lucie from dow Worried, Lucie gets up and leaves the room. Lea is watchi 69. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - HALLWAY - KITCHEN - BACKYARD - D In the hallway, before Lucie comes into the kitchen, Ahma gestures to Lucie no to be worried and that her mother on speak with her. Lucie goes towards the kitchen. Marie is a zombie in the backyard behind the kitchen and smoking a Lucie slowly walks in and stands in a corner of the kitch looking at her mother. A heavy silence. Marie realizes Lu kitchen. She comes back inside. She is consumed by anger, shaking with rage.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Is what Ahmad said true? Lucie nods. Marie suddenly loses control and lunges towar has burst into tears, she takes Lucie by the arms and sha violently while crying and screaming at her.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (crying) Why did you do that to me? What did I ever do to you? Lucie shows no reaction. She too is crying. She does not against her mother’s beating. It is clear that she is fee Marie. Ahmad who has heard the commotion, rushes into the separate Lucie from her mother’s grip. Marie is too angry go. He manages to free Lucie and pulls Marie to a corner kitchen. Lea has also come down and is witnessing this fi suddenly starts punching her own stomach. Ahmad holds her prevent her from doing this.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Stop it, Marie! Calm down!

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You little shit!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Marie! Easy...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Get your hands off me!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You promised not to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lucie) Get out of this house! Get out! Again Marie tries to lunge at Lucie. Ahmad struggles to s sends Lucie out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (to Lucie) Go. Marie aimlessly walks around the kitchen. Ahmad comes tow try and calm her down.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: She’s in enough pain. I asked her to tell you. She could’ve stopped me from talking to you. I could’ve asked her to keep the secret. You’d have preferred not to know anything for the rest of your life? Marie suddenly lashes out at Ahmad.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Will you shut up!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Remember you’re the one who wrote those emails. She only forwarded them.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hear you. I hate it when you lecture me! It disgusts me!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (to Lea) Go to your room sweetheart... Ahmad walks towards Lea, sends her out of the kitchen and door.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I’m not lecturing you! You asked me to come here and talk to Lucie!

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (screaming and crying) Fuck off! I didn’t ask you here for Lucie! I asked you to come here after four years just to sign that fucking piece of paper and then get lost forever!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Listen. Why didn’t you ask me to come last year? Why do I have to be here in the middle of this shit...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: without even knowing you’ re getting married?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (angry) Read your emails!

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: And you didn’t book me a hotel. And you made me sleep next to his son. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I sent you an your email...

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You made me come here just to get revenge. That’s all it’s about.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (angry and sarcastic) Yes, you're right. Happy?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Just before seeing the judge, you tell me you’re pregnant. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Do,’t you want to get out of here? Just leave for good? Please... Lea runs into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: She’s leaving! Ahmad is worried. He comes out of the kitchen with Lea. A frustrated, Marie sits at the kitchen table. 70. EXT. MARIE’S HOUSE - STREET - DAY Lucie, her eyes puffy and teary, walks quickly down the s runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Lucie!.. Lucie! Although she can hear him, Lucie does not respond to his reaches her and blocks her path.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Ahmad Ahmad Lucie does not respond and tries to go around him. Ahmad hand.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (firmly) Come back!

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Who are you to boss me around? Ahmad has nothing to say to her.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Lucie, your mother is not feeling well right now. Plese, don’t make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Why did you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You said I could.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You left me no choice.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I wanted to spare you suffering.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Am I not suffering now? Am I well? Ahmad does not respond. Lucie pulls her hand from his and is upset. Lucie continues walking, then again she stops.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Can you lend me some money?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Wait, I’11 come with you. Lucie waits at Ahmad’s insistence. Ahmad rushes back to t goes inside. 71. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - HALLWAY AND KITCHEN - DAY Ahmad is rushing down the stairs and putting on his coat. towards the kitchen. Lea is standing in the kitchen doorw Marie, who has stopped crying, is sitting at the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Wait.. 1/11 go. Marie comes out of the kitchen and walks towards the fron looking at Ahmad who is standing there not knowing what t comes towards her. Together they walk into the kitchen. A the chair and Lea gently leans against him and stands the

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: What was in those emails?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I don’t know... 72. EXT. MARIE’S HOUSE - STREET - DAY Marie has reached Lucie who is standing on the side of th quickly looks at her in silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Come back home. Lucie looks at her mother in silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Let’s get back in. 73. INT. SHAHRYAR’S HOUSE - WORK ROOM - DAY Ahmad is sitting at a workbench.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) Ahamd, look at me. Don’t get sucked back into this. Cut. Remember Mitra and me? Cut. Life goes on without you and me.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: (in Persian) I think to myself if I hadn’t left four years ago...

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRYAR
dialogues.text: (in Persian) You would’ve left a year later.. if not, two years later. I told you from the beginning, you were not made for this place. You have to choose. It’s either one way or the other. You can’t have it both ways. Ahmad has nothing to say to Shahryar. 74, INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT She Marie is holding her phone, full trepidation, she paces b in the kitchen. She dials a couple of numbers, but she ch and hangs up. Lucie quietly comes into the kitchen from t She is looking at the phone in her mother’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell him? Marie just looks at Lucie. She has no answer.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to. Marie thinks of what Lucie has said. She sits down at th table.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Go to bed. And turn off the light, please. Lucie turns off the light and leaves the kitchen. Marie p phone on the table and stays there in the darkness. 75. EXT. SIDEWALK OUTSIDE THE DRYCLEANER’S - DAY Marie is walking down the sidewalk. It’s a long walk to t drycleaner’s. From her eyes, it is clear that she has not night’s sleep. 76. INT. DRYCLEANER’S - DAY - CONTINUED Marie enters the drycleaner’s. Naima is busy getting the out of the large washing machine. Fouad is busy drawing i Naima notices Marie who has now come to this side of the

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: Hello, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hello. Is Samir here?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: He’s upstairs. Marie goes towards the back door. 77. INT. SAMIR’S HOUSE - STAIRWAY - DAY Marie climbs the narrow stairway, which connects the dry Samir’s house on the second floor. She rings the doorbell 78. INT. SAMIR’S HOUSE - DAY A small house located above the dry cleaner’s with window street. It is clear that life has not flowed in this hous time and everything is a mess. From the vanity drawer, Sa the half-full perfume bottles belonging to his wife. Mari a bit further away.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What’s all this?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Her perfumes. I’m taking them to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: A silence ensues. is staring at the Samir has noticed For a test. One of her nurses was saying that the memory of smell is the last one you lose. Samir places the perfume bottles on the table. Marie perfumes. She takes one of them and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: That is your cologne...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: She liked it. something suspicious in Marie’s expression.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Why don’t you sit?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
