dialogues.text: I have to go. Marie is not feeling like she usually does. He is waiting speak.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don’t like it when hide your feelings.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I’m not hiding anything.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You mean you are not happy?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Is it not good news that there is still hope that she can react to something?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You're stuck between your wife and me.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You ralized that overnight?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I’ve felt it for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You didn’t say things like that until last week. The weight of Samir’s coment sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I always felt it but I wasn’t brave enough to tell you earlier. Maybe I wasn’t sure of what I felt.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: That I am only here to fill the void left by your wife. Samir is hurt by Marie. A brief silence.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Whose void am I supposed to fill in your life?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (upset) No one’s.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I’m not here to make up for your failed marriage ?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: If that was the case, I wouldn’t be carrying your child.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: That was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I could’ve not kept it.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You kept it because you wanted to erase that man, to convince yourself that it was over, that you’d turned  the page and you were starting something new with someone else. But the problem is that you're still not convinced. Otherwise, you wouldn’t have brought him home, you’d have let him go to a hotel. Marie is staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Ever since he’s come back, you've changed. I don’t even recognize you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I feel this way because I’ve found out why your wife...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Leave her out oh this, please.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She knew...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You sound like your crazy daughter.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: If she’d known, she’d have said something to me at some point.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She never asked about me?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Ask what?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Why I came so often...

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: For her, you were just a customer.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What about you? Didn’t she suspect you?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: No. I wish she had. At least, it’d have meant she cared enough to try and find out if there was someone else. Marie is silent for a moment. Samir places the perfumes i Marie gets up to walk towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Lucie sent her our emails. Samir is shocked, staring at Marie. There is a heavy sile them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd she get her email?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Your wife gave it to her.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: But they never met...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Lucie called her at the shop and told her she had emails we had sent each other and that she wanted to forward them. Your wife accepted. Samir stares at Marie in disbelief. Again, there is silen them.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: When did she call her?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: The day before her suicide. Samir drops his gaze and stares at the perfumes. Marie le house. 79, INT. DRY CLEANER’S - DAY Samir enters the dry cleaner’s from the back door. He is Naima is writing up an order for a customer. He waits for to leave. He is looking at Fouad who is still drawing in As soon as the customer leaves, he calls Naima.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Naima... come here a second. Naima walks towards Samir.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: After the fight with Celine... you know, when I asked her to go... did she ever come by the shop when I was out?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What about when she wanted to go upstairs? Would she pass through here?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: I didn’t see her the last few days.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: She was always up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She only came down the day it happened.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Not the day before?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: No, why?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Someone says that they called here and talked to my wife. A costumer comes and Naima goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upset, Marie is filling the prescription for a customer. Samir who is waiting for her outside the pharmacy. She qu prescription for the customer and sends her to the regist comes out of the pharmacy. Her co-worker who is ringing u customer, is frustrated with Marie’s sloppy work. She gla and sees Marie and Samir talking. 81. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - DOWNSTAIRS BEDROOM - NIGHT A small lamp is on. Marie is lying on her bed by herself staring out into space. The door gently opens. Lucie come realizes Lucie is there but shows no reaction. Lucie come bed. She pulls the blanket to the side and lies down next who has her back towards her. She pulls the blanket over moment, they lie like this side by side. Lucie turns towa mother. She holds her from behind. Marie takes her hand a to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Promise not to lie to me again.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: When did I lie to you?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: When you say you’d forwarded the emails. Lucie is shocked at hearing this but she does not respond look, it is clear that she is debating whether to speak o silent.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You promise? Lucie remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Why do you think it was a lie?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Because she wasn’t at the shop the day before her suicide. Again Lucie is silent. She lets go of her mother and turn back. She stares at the ceiling. Marie is surprised at he turns her head towards her. She looks at Lucie. Lucie spe response to Marie’s inquisitive gaze.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: I spoke to her.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIE
dialogues.text: Yes. She had an accent.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: His wife is French. Now they are both thinking the same thing. Marie is worri 82. INT. DRYCLEANER’S - EXT. SIDEWALK - MORNING Samir is waiting for Naima to arrive, it is clear that he upset and angry. A brief moment passes. Naima enters.

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: ‘Morning. Naima goes to the back, takes off her jacket and hangs it her purse. Samir stands opposite her and stares into her worried,

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Why did you pretend to be my wife and gave her email? Naima is scared. She does not react. Samir is angry, stil her to answer.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Naima is silent. Fouad, just woken I’m not asking for an apology. I’m asking why!

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: She didn’t like me.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: She hated me.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Had you done something?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Then why did she hate you?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: She thought there was something going on between us.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: She thought that? Why would she?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Why would she think that?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: Because you hired me even though I was illegal.. she was suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Did she say anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Where are you getting this crap then?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: She was always after me, so I thought... up, has opened the back door and come inside.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You thought?... Get out. She never asked me to fire you.

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: But she kept doing things to get you to fire me..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: Lots of things.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What kind of things?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: The day of the fight, the customer called the police, she wouldn’t let me leave, she wanted me to stay.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: She wanted the police to find out about me.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: That’s it? That’s why she’s ina coma?... Get out.

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: That dress.. I took it out of the machine. I took it, I ironed it, I wrapped it up... there was no stain! She made the stain, I’m sure. I’ve been here for a year, I’ve never seen a stain like that.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: How much do I owe you? Again Naima does not respond. Samir comes to the counter. some money from his pocket. He puts several bills on the goes out to the sidewalk. Fouad is staring at Naima who i walks towards her jacket and purse. 83. EXT. DRYCLEANER’S - SIDEWALK - DAY Samir is on the sidewalk. He is clearly upset. Carrying h her shoulder, Naima comes out of the drycleaner’s. For a pauses, then goes back towards the Samir.

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: I wanted her to know there was nothing between us. You were always upset, thinking about someone else , she thought it was me. The day of the fight, you asked me to stay, you took my hand and you asked her to leave. I saw her eyes for a second, I knew what she was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (angry)  Because of what you did, this kid’s mother has been a vegetable in a hospital bed for the past eight months.

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: It’s not because of what I did.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You gave her email to that brat.

dialogues.speaker: NAIMA
dialogues.text: If she had read the emails, she would have understood everything. Why’d she have come and drunk the detergent in front of me? She’d have gone to the pharmacy and killed herself in front of her. Or upstairs, in front of you. Why in front of me? Samir has no response. Sad, Naima walks off and grows sma distance. Samir is even more frustrated than before. 84. INT. DRY CLEANER’S - DAY Samir reenters the shop. He closes the front door. He mov of the shop and walks through the racks of clothing. From clothes, he finds the dress Naima was talking about. He b He takes its cover off. He searches for the stain, looks carefully and smells it. 85. INT. SAMIR’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - DAY Samir and Fouad are in the bathroom. Fouad is sitting on the bathtub and Samir is clipping his fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: She’s not coming back?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Naima.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: She did something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: But she said sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Some things are unforgivable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? Samir doesn’t know how to explain what's happening to Fou looks at him. He holds up his other hand and continues to nails. He sees the band-aid on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: What happened to your finger?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Nothing. Samir takes off the band-aid.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I want to go back to Lea’s.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: We can’t go for now.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: When then?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Not as long as we don’t know about Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: When will we know?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I get bored here by myself.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Why don’t you come down to see me?

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: I don’t like it downstairs. Samir looks down and continues clipping his nails. It is is trying to hide the tears he feels after what Fouad has

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir walks along the sidewalk. He reaches the pharmacy. stopping, he sneaks a peak inside the pharmacy. Marie is the prescription for an old male customer. Samir passes t and turns onto the next street. He stops a few yards away back and forth for a bit. He is hesitant. He goes back th came, this time without looking inside the pharmacy. He g towards the drycleaner’s. He ears Marie’s voice from behi

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Samir! He stops and sees Marie who has come out of the pharmacy standing on the sidewalk. 87. INT. DRY CLEANER’S - EXT. SIDEWALK - DAY Fouad is busy drawing in a corner of the drycleaner’s. Th of the store is locked. Samir and Marie are on the sidewa reached the door. Samir unlocks the door and they both co again locks the door from the inside. Fouad comes out for clothing racks.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hello. Marie goes towards him. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: (to Fouad) Go upstairs, Fouad.

dialogues.speaker: FOUAD
dialogues.text: And then I’1l go with Marie?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Go get your things. Make a drawing for Mommy, ok? Samir accompanies Fouad to the back door. Fouad leaves. M chair by the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Do you think she got our emails?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: If she’d read them, she would’ve at least said something to you.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Since the fight with the customer, we'd stopped speaking. It lasted until the end.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Even if she’d read them, yesterday you said she wouldn’t have cared. Samir is silent.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Would she have cared?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Maybe.I don’t know. I’d rather talk about now. That was then. It’s over. What I know now is that you're carrying our child. We just have to forget.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: It should be.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What if it isn’t? Marie is deep in thought. 88. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - EXT. BACK YARD - DAY Ahmad is standing in a corner and watching Marie who is f kettle in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: Is your wrist better?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It still hurts a bit.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: You went to see a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It’s normal. It’s the lack of calcium. The baby’s taking it all.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: How far along are you?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: A bit more than two months.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I thought you’d hurt yourself painting.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, maybe. There’s a brief silence between them. Marie places the ke stove and turns it on.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: There’s something I want to tell you before I go.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: About when I left four years ago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s pointless now.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I want to explain why I didn’t...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No.. I don’t want to look back anymore. Forget it. Again there’s silence.

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I’m off, then.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: And your things in the shed?

dialogues.speaker: AHMAD
dialogues.text: I don’t want them.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Take them. Ahmad notices Marie’s state. From the kitchen door, he en backyard to gather his belongings in the shed. 89. EXT. MARIE’S HOUSE - YARD - DAY Ahmad comes to the yard holding a dusty suitcase. Lea and busy playing with Lea’s helicopter. Ahmad goes towards Le her. Fouad is watching them. Lea smiles. Ahmad looks at F hugs him. 90. INT. MARIE’S HOUSE - UPSTAIRS ROOM - EXT. YARD - DAY Lucie looks out at the yard from the window of her room. Ahmad say goodbye to Lea and Fouad and walk toward the fr children see him off. Ahmad goes onto the street. To bett leave, Lucie places one foot on the bed and raises hersel Ahmad fades into the distance. Lucie stays there till Ahm from view. Once he is gone, she comes down from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir is in the hallway outside the door to his wife’s ro looking inside the room. 92. INT. HOSPITAL - HALLWAY AND PATIENT’S ROOM - DAY From Samir’s point of view, a doctor and nurse can be see in which Samir’s wife is in a coma. They are performing t examining her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, Samir has approached the door. The doctor comes room. Samir’s inquisitive eyes are directed at him. The s takes Samir aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately she had no reaction.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: None?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: None that I registered.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: You mean the scratches on her stomach, were involuntary?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Possibly. As I told you, these tests don’t reflect her state of consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: But she’d never scratched herself before.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I really can’t say. The nurses may have done it when moving her in her bed. Theses patients have fragile skin.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Doctor... how can I be sure it’s not her?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: By doing further tests. But even if the other tests results are negative, there’1l still be room for doubt. In these cases, you can never be sure. The doctor leaves. From the doorway, Samir is looking ins The nurse who is busy collecting the perfumes, comes out and walks towards Samir.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I put the perfumes by her bed.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: Did you test all of them?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: No just a couple of them. The nurse leaves. Samir enters the room. 94, INT. HOSPITAL - PATIENT’S ROOM - DAY Samir comes into the room. His ill wife is lying motionle On the walls are drawings which were drawn by Fouad. Sami box of perfumes to reluctently leave the room. As he exit hesitates and goes back to his wife’s side. He sits by he and stares at her. He takes the men’s cologne, the scent his wife liked, and pours some of it onto the palm of his holds his hand gently in front of his wife’s nose. He low towards her ear and whispers something to her. He stares and feet to see a reaction. He keeps holding his hand up He places his finger in Celine’s motionless hand.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR
dialogues.text: If you can smell the perfume, squeeze my hand, Celine. He keeps watching his finger and Celine’s hand. The end t and fade on this shot.
